Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 2311C, PHY 2048C    both with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Fundamental concepts of mechanics, including resultants of force systems, free-body diagrams, equilibrium of rigid bodies, and analyses of structures.

EGN3365 - Structure and Properties of Ma.name: EGN3365 - Structure and Properties of Materials

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (CHS 1440 or CHM 2045C) and MAC 2312 with grades of "C" (2.0) or better in both.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Atomic structure and bonding, crystal structure and imperfections, solidification, phase transformations, phase diagrams, heat treatment, mechanical & electrical properties, materials characterization techniques.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Materials Science and Engineering

EGN3365H - Honors Structure and Properti.name: EGN3365H - Honors Structure and Properties of Materials

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 2312, and (CHS 1440 or CHM 2045C), with grades of "C" (2.0) or better in both; and consent of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Atomic bonding; lattices; phonons; crystal structure; diffraction; defects; diffusion; phase equilibria and diagrams; transformations kinetics; mechanical, thermal, electrical, optical, and magnetic properties. With Honors content.

Department.text: Department of Materials Science and Engineering

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Kinematics and kinetics of particles and rigid bodies; mass and acceleration, work and energy, impulse and momentum, introduction to kinematics of mechanisms; introduction to 3D rigid body dynamics; central force.
